column17: The attack took place in Wessenaar, Hague, Netherlands.
column18: 12/24/2008: On Wednesday, the Dutch Animal Liberation Front claimed responsibility for setting two cars on fire in Wassenaar, Hague, Netherlands. The cars were owned by a senior stock exchange official for Euronext Stock Exchange. The company trades shares for the British company Huntingdon Life Sciences, which is the suspected reason behind the attack. No casualties were reported.
column39: Two cars owned by a senior stock exchange official for Euronext Stock Exchange
column64: The company the car owner works for trades shares for the British company Huntingdon Life Sciences, which is the suspected reason behind the attack.
column97: Arson was used in the attack.
column108: Damage was done to the two cars.

column17: The incident occurred at a mosque on Bella Vista Street.
column18: 11/07/2010: On Sunday, on Bella Vista Street in Almelo, Pverijssel, Netherlands, a suspicious parcel was found at a mosque. After a further investigation, local authorities found an improvised explosive device, which they safely defused. No casualties were reported and no group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
column39: A mosque was targeted in the bombing.
column64: The specific motive for the attack is unknown.
column97: An improvised explosive device was used in the attack.
column130: \"\"Parcel Bomb Forces Evacuation of Dutch Mosque"

201102200004,2011,2,20,",0,",142,8,Western Europe,South Holland,The Hague,52.069858,4.291111,1,0,The attack took place at the Libyan Consulate in The Hague
column136: 02/20/2011: On Sunday morning, in The Hague, Zuid Holland, Netherlands, a fire was seen at the front door of the Libyan Consulate by a passer-by. Officials were notified and responded to the location. The fire was suppressed before any major damage could occur, although the door and front of the building were scorched black by the fire. The fire may be linked to news of civil unrest and attacks on civilians by the government occurring in Libya. No casualties were reported and no group claimed responsibility for the attack.
column182: The specific motive for the attack is unknown.
column215: An unknown incendiary device was used in the attack.
column226: The attack burned and damaged the door and the front of the Libyan Consulate.
column245: \"\"Dutch Police Suspect Arson in Libyan Consulate Fire"
column255: 09/07/2011: On Wednesday night into Thursday, in Hilversum, Noord Holland, Netherlands, unidentified assailants attacked the Hilversumsche Golf Club holding the 2011 KLM Open. KLM is the world's largest carrier of primates and other animals for biomedical research. The assailants attacked and destroyed four putting greens, causing an unknown amount of damage. No group claimed responsibility, although the Animal Liberation Front (ALF) - Netherlands is suspected.
column284: The KLM Royal Dutch Airlines was targeted.
column301: The specific motive for the attack was to intimidate the KLM company and stop the transport of animals to biomedical research laboratories.
column334: Unknown sabotage equipment was used in the attack.
column345: The attack caused some damage to the golf course.
column369: \"\"Dyson's 65 Leads KLM Open Hit by Rain"
